# Resource (hush_postgres_access_privilege)

Manage PostgreSQL access privileges in the Hush Security platform.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Create a PostgreSQL access privilege
resource "hush_postgres_access_privilege" "example" {
  name        = "app-read-write"
  description = "Read/write access to application tables"

  grants {
    privileges = ["SELECT", "INSERT", "UPDATE"]
    object_type = "table"
    all_in_schema = "public"
  }

  grants {
    privileges = ["USAGE"]
    object_type = "sequence"
    all_in_schema = "public"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `grants` (Block List, Min: 1) The list of privilege grants (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--grants))
- `name` (String) The name of the PostgreSQL access privilege

### Optional

- `description` (String) The description of the PostgreSQL access privilege

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the PostgreSQL access privilege
- `type` (String) The type of access privilege

<a id="nestedblock--grants"></a>
### Nested Schema for `grants`

Required:

- `object_type` (String) The type of database object (TABLE, SEQUENCE, FUNCTION, SCHEMA, DATABASE)
- `privileges` (List of String) The list of PostgreSQL privileges (e.g., SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE)

Optional:

- `all_in_schema` (Boolean) Grant on all objects of the given type in the specified schema
- `column_names` (List of String) The names of the columns (for column-level privileges)
- `object_names` (List of String) The names of the database objects
